intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis pallida, commonly known as the pale pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features slender, dark green leaves and produces delicate, white or pale yellow flowers with a subtle fragrance. It is part of the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is known for its relatively simple floral structure. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a challenging plant to cultivate outside its natural range.
